title: [bug] Impossible to create a rounded transparent window without borders
body:
### Describe the bug

Before the v1 RC, it was possible to make rounded window borders on macOS by making the window transparent in the `tauri.conf.json`, disabling the decorations and then rounding the borders of the first non-transparent element.

Now, it seems to be impossible to achieve such behavior.

### Reproduction

1. Clone repo: https://github.com/elvinaspredkelis/tauri_1_app
2. Run `tauri dev`

The window has a white background even if the root elements are set to be transparent. And the first element has a rounded border which should make the window appear rounded too.

### Expected behavior

Transparent window bounding to the first non-transparent element in the view.

E.g. Making the `<body>` tag transparent and the first element inside it has `border-radius`. As it's impossible to apply border radius to the `<body>` element. Therefore, it should make the window have rounded borders. 

It was possible to do in earlier releases.
